items.title: Ski resort fire witnesses recall how tragic Crans-Montana blaze unfolded
items.description: As the resort town of Crans-Montana reels from the news of a tragic fire at a New Year's Eve party, a witness recalls hearing screams and seeing people covered in blood in the aftermath of the bar blaze.

items.title: Trump says health scan gave critics 'ammunition', blames bruising on aspirin
items.description: US President Donald Trump says he regrets undergoing advanced imagery on his heart and abdomen because of the "ammunition" it handed his critics, but has once more defended his "perfect" health.

items.title: China's anti-pollution crusade linked to Australian bushfires
items.description: As China caps off a historic clean-up of its smog and air pollution, the clearer air is helping temperatures rise to new records. Now, researchers are linking that change to hotter and drier conditions in Australia.

items.title: Khawaja hits out at 'racial steroetypes' as he announces Test retirement
items.description: Australia batter Usman Khawaja announces he will retire from international cricket after the fifth and final Ashes Test at the SCG, which starts on Sunday.

items.title: Khawaja's on-field brilliance pales in comparison to his true impact
items.description: Before his debut in 2011, Australia had never seen a cricketer like Usman Khawaja and, thanks to his work on and off the field, he'll be followed by plenty more.

items.title: China's beef tariffs aren't about Australia
items.description: Beijing's new measures are aimed at trying to rein in an Australian surge and manage local growth, rather than a direct target on Australia.

items.title: Brisbane beats Sydney and Melbourne in price growth
items.description: Brisbane's housing market remains one of the strongest in the nation, with prices up 1.6 per cent in December even as Sydney and Melbourne see some growth moderation in property valuations.

items.title: 'Everybody knows her': Sydney mother one of three drowning victims
items.description: The identity of one of three people who died in a cluster of drownings on the New South Wales coast in recent days has been confirmed as a Sydney hairdresser and mother.

items.title: Easter Island researchers say giant statues 'walked' into position
items.description: A study using 11,600 aerial drone photos to map a mountainous quarry in 3D reveals more about how the island's famed stone sentinels were created and moved to their final resting places.

items.title: Lachie Neale apologises for actions that led to marriage breakdown
items.description: The club said the 32-year-old had made the decision following a "challenging personal period".

items.title: Greens member 'blindsides' Tasmanian party by quitting
items.description: The Clark MP says she knows the decision "will be disappointing for some," but it is necessary for her to be "effective" in parliament — a move that has "blindsided" her former colleagues.

items.title: Bernie Sanders swears in Zohran Mamdani with a word of warning
items.description: New York's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, has vowed not to water down his ambitious agenda during an impassioned inauguration address outside City Hall. But is his vision achievable?

items.title: Nation's biggest employer groups now support royal commission into Bondi attack
items.description: Former Reserve Bank governors and CEOs are among more than 130 business leaders and prominent Australians calling for a Commonwealth royal commission in the wake of the Bondi Beach terror attack.

items.title: 'A hunger revolution': Inside the massive protests sweeping Iran
items.description: Protests spread from the capital Tehran to other cities and across demographics, with people demanding Iran's leaders end the country's clerical rule and hold free elections.

items.title: Weekly news quiz: Ravenous ladybirds, a grumpy seal and a unique home
items.description: As we start the new year, take some time out to explore some of the other stories you might have missed this holiday period.

items.title: Williams to set new Australian Open record at 45 after receiving wildcard
items.description: Venus Williams will play in the main draw of the Australian Open for the first time since 2021, 28 years after she first graced Melbourne Park.

items.title: Add these must-do regional festivals to your 2026 calendar
items.description: From pint-sized penny farthings to tuna tosses, a beer can regatta to the Running of the Sheep, there's a regional festival for everyone's interests.

items.title: Why severe storms keep forming over Queensland's Darling Downs
items.description: Queensland's Darling Downs has recorded more severe storm warning days than any other region this season — and meteorologists say it is no coincidence.

items.title: Kidnapper was 'saving boys from aliens' when he snatched them from bed
items.description: A man who abducted a boy from his bed in regional WA after sniffing butane and having delusions about aliens is sentenced to eight years in prison.

items.title: Family watches Boddington heritage property burn in Christmas Day fire
items.description: Two heritage homes and thousands of hectares of land were lost in a Christmas Day bushfire in Boddington.

items.title: Roads, rail, runways impacted as outback flooding continues
items.description: Rain has hit saturation point in parts of northern Queensland as communities remain isolated and cattle are lost.

items.title: Man accused of wild rampage across Latrobe Valley appears in court
items.description: A 34-year-old man has been remanded in custody after allegedly going on a multi-day crime spree across Victoria's south-east involving carjackings, burglaries and a police pursuit.

items.title: This Melbourne suburb has been on the decline, but a new future beckons
items.description: Richmond's Victoria Street, once a buzzing area home to dozens of restaurants and grocers, has seen better days. What can be done to bring it back to its bustling best?

items.title: NT to introduce Voluntary Assisted Dying bill mid-2026
items.description: The Northern Territory government says it will introduce Voluntary Assisted Dying legislation to parliament this year, nearly two decades after the Commonwealth vetoed the NT’s world-first euthanasia legislation in 1997.

items.title: Bikies allegedly sat waiting in hair salon before stabbing two men
items.description: In just four minutes, two men were stabbed in the chest and customers inside the Queanbeyan hair salon were left shaken.
